title: How to Tie a Tippet to a Leader

steps.title: Place the leader and tippet side by side so that they overlap by 6 in (15 cm).
steps.content: Place the leader and tippet side by side so that they overlap by 6 in (15 cm). Position the lines with the tag ends facing in opposite directions. Hold the leader line and the tag end of the tippet together by pinching them between your thumb and forefinger on your non-dominant hand where they meet. [1] X Research source Tag end refers to the end of the line that you are using to tie the knot.

steps.title: Create a loop with the 2 lines together.
steps.content: Create a loop with the 2 lines together. Use your dominant hand to create an overhand knot with the tag end of the leader, and pass the leader and tippet tag ends through the loop once. Do not tighten the knot all the way. It should be an open loop. At this point the loop will look like a loose pretzel.

steps.title: Pass the leader and the tippet through the loop another time.
steps.content: Pass the leader and the tippet through the loop another time. Hold the loop in your non-dominant hand. Twist the leader and tippet tag ends around the loop and pass them through again. Do not fully tighten the knot yet. [2] X Research source The loop will now look like it has a small braid on the top side.

steps.title: Moisten the loop and pull on the leader and tippet lines to tighten the knot.
steps.content: Moisten the loop and pull on the leader and tippet lines to tighten the knot. Use saliva to moisten the loop. Pull the leader line and tippet tag end with your left hand, and the tippet line and leader tag end with your right hand simultaneously until the knot is fully closed. Lip balm also makes a good moistener for the line if you don’t want to use saliva. Pull each side slowly to tighten the knot evenly. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Clip the tag ends so that they are close to the knot.
steps.content: Clip the tag ends so that they are close to the knot. Use nail clippers, scissors, or pliers to clip the tag ends of the leader and tippet to finish the knot. Try to get them as short and close to the knot as possible so that there are no loose ends. Once you learn this knot it is very strong and fast to tie! [4] X Research source

steps.title: Overlap the ends of the leader and tippet lines by 6 in (15 cm).
steps.content: Overlap the ends of the leader and tippet lines by 6 in (15 cm). Hold them together in your non-dominant hand by pinching where they overlap. Keep your dominant hand free to tie the lines together. [5] X Research source Tag end means the end of the line where you are tying the knot. The blood knot can be used to tie any two lines of the same diameter together.

steps.title: Twist the tag end of the tippet around the leader line 5 times.
steps.content: Twist the tag end of the tippet around the leader line 5 times. Use your dominant hand to wrap one line in a coil, like a spring, around the other line. Then pull the tag end back and through the middle where the two lines meet. [6] X Research source You can wrap one line around the other up to 7 times for a stronger variation of this knot.

steps.title: Wrap the tag end of the leader around the tippet line 5 times.
steps.content: Wrap the tag end of the leader around the tippet line 5 times. Repeat the coiling process for the other side. Pull the leader tag end back through the middle where the lines meet in the middle so that it is facing in the opposite direction of the tippet tag end. [7] X Research source The knot will now look like it has two spring coils, one on either side. The tag ends will be facing opposite directions, one going out through the middle to the top and one to the bottom. [8] X Research source

steps.title: Pull the lines slowly in opposite directions to tighten the knot.
steps.content: Pull the lines slowly in opposite directions to tighten the knot. Take one line in each hand and pull them to close the knot. As you do this the twists will gather together and tighten. [9] X Research source

steps.title: Clip the ends of the lines to finish the knot.
steps.content: Clip the ends of the lines to finish the knot. Trim the tag ends so they are not long and loose. You now have a tight and strong knot holding the tippet and leader lines together! [10] X Research source The blood knot is not quite as strong as the double surgeon’s knot, but it creates a straighter connection between the two lines, which can help when casting your line.
